titleStmt.title: Loves power. Behold the powerful charms of love, with captives young and old, and nothing can their flames remove, that are in Cupids fold: 'till soft'ning kisses heal the wound caus'd by loves fiery dart, then pleasures flow, and joys abound, and more inflames the heart. To the tune of, Moggies jealousie.

notesStmt.note: Date of publication suggested by item of same title in Wing (L3281A).
Verse: "Two lovers by chance they did meet ..."
Imperfect: trimmed, affecting imprint and, perhaps, title.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
